data.enText: to keep sb/sth inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.

data.chText: 此项工作不会局限于格拉斯哥地区。
data.enText: The work will not be confined to the Glasgow area.

data.chText: 我将把自己考察的范围限定在1900年至1916年这段时间以内。
data.enText: I will confine myself to looking at the period from 1900 to 1916.
to keep a person or an animal in a small or closed space

data.chText: 把狗关进适于旅行的笼子里。
data.enText: Keep the dog confined in a suitable travelling cage.

data.chText: 这条河在这里流入狭窄的河床。
data.enText: Here the river is confined in a narrow channel.

data.chText: 有关的士兵已受到不得离开营房的禁闭处分。
data.enText: The soldiers concerned were confined to barracks (= had to stay in the barracks , as a punishment)

texts: be confined to bed, a wheelchair, etc.

data.chText: 使离不开（或受困于床、轮椅等）
data.enText: to have to stay in bed, in a wheelchair , etc.
She was confined to bed with the flu.

data.chText: 经过那场事故后他就离不开轮椅了。
data.enText: He was confined to a wheelchair after the accident.

simple_means.memory_skill: con 加强 + fin 范围 + e → 进入〔别人〕范围 → 限制

means: 使离不开(或受困于床、轮椅等)

ex.enText: His talk is limited to 30 minutes.

synonyms.bx: 指在时间、数量、水平等方面加以限制，侧重事物的限度。

ex.chText: 他们把研究限定在12个案例以内。
ex.enText: They confined their study to 12 cases.

ex.chText: 此项工作不会局限于这一地区。
ex.enText: The work will not be confined to this area.

synonyms.bx: 指将某人或某事物限制在某活动、主题、地区等范围之内，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 你可以限制某些文档的传阅人数。
ex.enText: You can restrict access to certain files.

synonyms.bx: 指控制某事物的大小、数量或范围，侧重限制行为。

example: restrict the use of this parking lot
limit the time you can spend with your friends

tr: restrict or confine, "I limit you to two visits to the pub a day"
to close within bounds, limit or hold back from movement
example: This holds the local until the express passengers change trains
About a dozen animals were held inside the stockade
The illegal immigrants were held at a detention center
The terrorists held the journalists for ransom

tr: prevent from leaving or from being removed

value.boxr_value: The verb is pronounced /kən'faɪn/. The noun confines is pronounced /'kɒnfaɪnz/. 动词读作 /kən'faɪn/。名词读作 /'kɒnfaɪnz/。

value.def: To confine something to a particular place or group means to prevent it from spreading beyond that place or group.

example.ex: Health officials have successfully confined the epidemic to the Tabatinga area...
example.tran: 卫生官员成功地将疫情控制在塔巴廷加地区。

example.ex: The US will soon be taking steps to confine the conflict.
example.tran: 美国很快就会采取措施限制冲突。

value.tran: 限制，限定（防止扩散蔓延）

value.def: If you confine yourself or your activities to something, you do only that thing and are involved with nothing else.

example.ex: He did not confine himself to the one language...
example.tran: 他没把自己局限于这一门语言。

example.ex: Yoko had largely confined her activities to the world of big business...
His genius was not confined to the decoration of buildings.
example.tran: 他的天赋不单体现在建筑物的装饰上。

value.tran: 限制(自己或自己的活动);使受局限

value.def: If someone is confined to a mental institution, prison, or other place, they are sent there and are not allowed to leave for a period of time.

example.ex: The woman will be confined to a mental institution...
example.tran: 这个女人将被关进精神病院。

example.ex: He announced that the army and police had been confined to barracks.
example.tran: 他通告说军队和警察已经被禁闭在营房中不得外出。

value.def: Something that is within the confines of an area or place is within the boundaries enclosing it.

example.ex: The movie is set entirely within the confines of the abandoned factory.
example.tran: 电影的拍摄完全是在这个废弃的工厂厂区内进行。

example.ex: ...the wild grass and weeds that grew in the confines of the grandstand.

value.def: The confines of a situation, system, or activity are the limits or restrictions it involves.

example.ex: ...away from the confines of the British class system...
example.tran: 超越英国社会等级制度的限制

example.ex: I can't stand the confines of this marriage.
example.tran: 我受不了这段婚姻的限制。

partsOfSpeech.dec: af 加强 + fin 结束；范围 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 能不断进入〔别人的〕范围 → 密切关系
con 加强 + fin 结束；范围 + e → 进入〔别人〕范围 → 限制
de 加强 + fin 结束；范围 + e → 确定范围 → 限定
de 加强 + fini〔= fin〕结束；范围 + tive …的 → 能结束的 → 决定性的
fin 结束；范围 + al …的 → 最后的；决定性的
fin 结束；范围 + ale → 结尾；终曲
final 最后的；决定性的 + ist 从事某职业的人 → 决赛选手
final 最后的；决定性的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 终结；定局
fin 结束；范围 + ance 状态，性质，状况 → 资金；财政
fin 结束；范围 + ish 使… → 完成，结束
fin 结束；范围 + ite 有…性质的 → 范围的 → 有限的
in 无 + finite 有限的 → 无限的
